intro: [WRONG START] Goepperia leonae, commonly known as the Leonae Calathea, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Marantaceae family and is characterized by its striking, mottled foliage with deep green and silver veins. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 feet, with broad, heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires consistent moisture and high humidity to flourish. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening and decorative purposes.
